page.title: 05THE COLNE RIVER
page.content: {The River Colne,}a northern tributary of {The Thames}enters our rectangle flowing south at {137010. }It has just been joined by {The river Ver}whose route through St Albans led to the name of the Roman town {Verulamian.} {The River Colne,}now in its lower course, meanders slowly over its flood plain, creating damp pasture conditions suitable only for the grazing of dairy herds from {Little {Munden Farm}and {Hill Farm. { {The Colne Valley Water Authority}have a control and pumping station in square {1299}at grid reference {129992 {The Colne river,}after passing under the M1 Motorway leaves our rectangle at{120982. {
